title: EastEnders star Maisie Smith teases Strictly Come Dancing's Children In Need special
text:
EastEnders star Maisie Smith teased Strictly Come Dancing's Children In Need special on Wednesday.

The actress, 18, is set to perform alongside her co-stars Louisa Lytton, Rick Champ and Rudolph Walker for the soap special.

Taking to Instagram, Maisie teased their first day of rehearsals with a now deleted clip of her and the actors dancing with their pro dance partners Kevin Clifton, Gorka Marquez, Luba Mushtuk and Nancy Xu.

Preview: EastEnders star Maisie Smith teased Strictly Come Dancing's Children In Need special with a now deleted behind-the-scenes snap of rehearsals on Wednesday

In the boomerang clip, Ricky could be seen sweeping Luba off her feet, while Louisa danced across the room with Gorka.

The Ruby Allen actress also took to Instagram to share a photo with her professional dance partner, as she wrote: 'Well here we go then!! I can’t remember a SINGLE step from my strictly experience 13 years ago but boy is this going to be fun!'

While Rick also joked on his own Instagram: 'I don’t mean to blow my own trumpet, but I can dance like the wind blows.'

Rehearsals: The snap saw Maisie, and co-stars Louisa Lytton, Rick Champ and Rudolph Walker dance with their pro partners Kevin Clifton, Gorka Marquez, Luba Mushtuk and Nancy Xu

On taking part in the special, Ricky said in a statement: 'I am so excited to be taking part in the Strictly Come Dancing special. I'm looking forward to showing the world my moves. Bring it on!'

While Louisa, who competed on the show in 2006, added: 'It feels like a lifetime ago since I did Strictly Come Dancing so I am beyond excited to put my dancing shoes back on and return to the famous floor. It’s for a fantastic cause which makes it all the more special.'

Rudolph also went on to joke: 'I am thrilled to be taking part in this year’s competition and can’t wait to get started. Although at 80 years old, it’s probably best I don’t try to do the splits!'

Fun: Louisa, who is partnered with Gorka Marquez, shared a snap and wrote: 'I can’t remember a SINGLE step from my strictly experience 13 years ago but boy is this going to be fun!'

Meanwhile, ten celebrities continue to compete for the Glitterball trophy in the show's current season.

In a dramatic twist on Sunday night, Catherine Tyldesley was axed over Mike Bushell - a decision made by head judge Shirley Ballas, who was criticised afterwards.

She said, while walking the Pride Of Britain red carpet on Monday, however, that she 'made the right decision'.
description: The actress, 18, teased Strictly Come Dancing's Children In Need special on Wednesday.
